Arms.name: Arm Circles
instructions: 1. Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Raise and extend your arms to the sides without bending the elbows.
3. Slowly rotate your arms forward, making small circles of about 1 foot in diameter.
4. Complete a set in one direction and then switch, rotating backward.

Arms.name: Bicep Curls
instructions: 1. Stand straight with a dumbbell or water bottles in each hand, your feet shoulder-width apart, and hands by your sides.
2. Squeeze the biceps and lift the dumbbells. Keep the elbows close to your body and the upper arms stationary, only the forearms should move.
3. Once the dumbbells are at shoulder level, slowly lower the arms to the starting position.
4. Repeat.

Arms.name: Chair Dips
instructions: 1. Sit on the edge of a bench or chair, hands supporting your weight.
2. Position your feet away from the bench, legs straight and heels on the floor.
3. Lower yourself until your upper arms are parallel to the ground, then push back up.
4. Repeat exercise.

Arms.name: Isometric Bicep Hold
instructions: 1. Hold dumbbells in each hand. If you do not have dumbbells, use full water bottles.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso and your palms facing up. Keeping your upper body stationary, bring the weights to a 90 degrees hold.
3. Hold for a minimum of 5 seconds or other given time.

Arms.name: Plank Shoulder Taps
instructions: 1. Start in a plank position, with your wrists under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart.
2. Touch your left shoulder with your right hand and return to plank position.
3. Touch your right shoulder with your left hand and continue alternating sides until the set is complete.

Arms.name: Reverse Plank
instructions: 1. Press into your palms and lift your hips and torso toward the ceiling. Look up to the ceiling during this move.
2. Squeeze your core and pull your belly button back toward your spine.
3. Lower your hips and torso back to the floor, returning to the starting position.

Arms.name: Walking Plank
instructions: 1. Get into a forearm plank with your shoulders in line with your elbows and forearms parallel to each other on the ground.
2. Pushing the ground with your right hand, straighten your right arm into a high plank, followed by your left arm.
3. Then, bring your right forearm back to the ground and then your left forearm.
4. Repeat exercise.

Arms.name: Push-Ups
instructions: 1. With your legs extended back, place the hands below the shoulders, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Start bending your elbows and lower your chest until it’s just above the floor.
3. Push back to the starting position.
4. Repeat exercise.

Arms.name: Diamond Push-Ups
instructions: 1. Get into a standard push-up position. Except this time move your hands together so that your thumbs are touching together and your index fingers are touching together, forming a diamond shape in the open area between your hands.
2. Next, lower yourself down to the ground so that your chest almost touches your hands, pause, then push yourself back up.
3. Repeat exercise.

Arms.name: Decline Push-Ups
instructions: 1. Place a bench or chair horizontally behind you and place both hands on a yoga mat slightly wider than shoulder-width with your feet together on the bench behind you, resting on the balls of your feet.
2. While maintaining a straight back and stabilising through your abdominals, bend your elbows and lower your torso towards the floor until your arms form two 90-degree angles.
3. Push through your chest and extend your arms to lift your body back into starting position.
4. Repeat exercise.

Arms.name: Incline Push-Ups
instructions: 1. Place a bench horizontally in front of you and place both hands on the bench slightly further than shoulder-width apart with feet together on the floor behind you, resting on the balls of your feet.
2. While maintaining a neutral spine, bend your elbows and lower your torso towards the bench until your arms form two 90-degree angles.
3. Push through your chest and extend your elbows to lift your body back into the starting position.
4. Repeat exercise.

Arms.name: Plank to Push-Ups
instructions: 1. Start in a push up position with hands and elbows stacked under your shoulders, with your body in a straight line from shoulders to heels.
2. Transition into a forearm plank by lowering down to rest on your forearms with elbows under the shoulders. Squeeze the abs to maintain a neutral spine.
3. Hold the plank for around 5 seconds, then transition back into push up position while keeping your knees and hips off the floor.
4. Bend at the elbows to lower your chest towards the floor to make a push up, make sure your arms stay close to your sides.
5. Push back into the starting position and repeat exercise.

Arms.name: Wall Push-Ups
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet a few feet away from a wall.
2. Slowly bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the wall.
3. Focus on keeping your body aligned as you pause in this position.
4. Push through your hands and straighten your arms, returning to the starting position.
5. Repeat exercise

Back.name: Bird Dogs
instructions: 1. Start on your hands and knees with the hands under the shoulders and the knees under the hips.
2. Extend one leg and the opposite arm at the same time.
3. Pause for 3 to 5 seconds, return to the starting position, and switch sides.
4. Repeat exercise.

Back.name: Cat Camel Stretch
instructions: 1. Get down on your hands and knees on the floor. Relax your head, and allow it to droop.
2. Round your back up toward the ceiling until you feel a nice stretch in your upper, middle, and lower back.
3. Hold this stretch for as long as it feels comfortable.
4. Return to the starting position with a flat back while you are on all fours.
5. Let your back sway by pressing your stomach toward the floor. Lift your buttocks toward the ceiling.
6. Hold this position for 15 to 30 seconds and return to the starting position.
7. Repeat at least 5 times.

Back.name: Cobra Pose
instructions: 1. Place your palms flat on the ground directly under your shoulders. Bend your elbows straight back and hug them into your sides.
2. Pause for a moment looking straight down at your mat with your neck in a neutral position. Anchor your pubic bone to the floor.
3. Inhale to lift your chest off the floor. Roll your shoulders back and keep your low ribs on the floor. Make sure your elbows continue hugging your sides. Don't let them wing out to either side.
4. Keep your neck neutral. Your gaze should stay on the floor.

Back.name: Dive Bomber
instructions: 1. Start in a downward dog position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your hips lifted towards the ceiling. From this position, shift your weight forward, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your hips lifted and your elbows tucked in close to your body.
2. As you lower your chest towards the ground, arch your back and look up towards the ceiling, moving into a swooping motion.
3. Then, reverse the movement by pushing through your arms, lifting your chest up and back towards the starting position while pressing your hips back towards the ceiling.

Back.name: Prone T Raises
instructions: 1. Lay face down on the floor with your arms outstretched to the sides, like the letter 'T'. Ensure you aren't shrugging your shoulders.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your arms off the floor and towards the ceiling, again without shrugging.
3. Hold for 2 seconds and return to starting position.
4. Repeat exercise.

Back.name: Prone W Raises
instructions: 1. Start by lying face down on a mat or exercise bench with your arms extended straight out in front of you, forming a W-shape with your thumbs pointing up toward the ceiling.

2. Engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine and lift your chest slightly off the ground. Keeping your arms in the W position, squeeze your shoulder blades together as you lift your elbows upward and outward, focusing on using the muscles of your upper back to perform the movement.
3. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your arms back down to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat exercise.

Back.name: Prone Y Raises
instructions: 1. Lie face down on a mat or exercise bench with your arms extended straight out in front of you, forming a Y-shape with your thumbs pointing up toward the ceiling.

2. Engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine and lift your chest slightly off the ground. Keeping your arms straight, lift them upward and outward in a controlled manner, focusing on using the muscles of your upper back and shoulders to perform the movement.
3. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your arms back down to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat exercise.

Back.name: Reverse Snow Angels
instructions: 1. Lie face down on a mat or exercise bench with your arms extended straight out to the sides, palms facing down towards the floor.

2. Engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine and lift your chest slightly off the ground. Keeping your arms straight, lift them upward and inward in a sweeping motion, bringing them towards each other above your head.
3. Hold the top position briefly, then reverse the motion and lower your arms back down to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat exercise.

Back.name: Seated Forward Folds
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight out in front of you.
2. Engage your core muscles to lengthen your spine and sit up tall. On an inhale, reach your arms overhead, lengthening your spine even more.

3. Then, on an exhale, hinge at your hips and slowly begin to fold forward from your hips, leading with your chest. Keep your spine long as you fold forward, reaching your hands towards your feet or shins.
4. Hold the forward fold for several breaths, breathing deeply into the stretch.

Back.name: Supermans
instructions: 1. Lie face down on a mat or exercise bench with your arms extended straight out in front of you and your legs extended straight behind you.
2. Engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine and lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground simultaneously, as if you're flying like Superman.
3. Squeeze your glutes and lower back muscles to lift your legs and chest as high as you comfortably can while keeping your neck in a neutral position.
4. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your arms, chest, and legs back down to the starting position with control.

Back.name: Swimmers
instructions: 1. Lie face down on a mat or exercise bench with your arms extended straight out in front of you and your legs extended straight behind you.
2. Engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine. Simultaneously lift your chest, arms, and legs off the ground, as if you're swimming through water.

3. Begin by lifting your right arm and left leg, then switch to lift your left arm and right leg in a swimming motion. Keep your movements controlled and fluid, focusing on using the muscles of your upper back and shoulders to perform the movement.
4. Continue alternating sides.

Core.name: Boat Pose
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Keep your spine tall and your hands resting on the floor beside your hips for support.
2. As you exhale, lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground. Your torso and legs should form a V shape.
3. Balance on your glutes while keeping your spine straight. Avoid rounding your back; instead, imagine lengthening through the crown of your head.

4. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, parallel to the floor, with your palms facing each other. Alternatively, you can hold onto the backs of your thighs for additional support, especially if you're a beginner.
5. Take deep breaths in and out as you hold the pose. Aim to maintain steady, even breaths to help you stay focused and relaxed.
6. Hold the pose for as long as you feel comfortable, aiming for 10-30 seconds to start. As you become more experienced, you can gradually increase the duration of your hold.
7. To release the pose, exhale as you lower your feet back to the floor, returning to a seated position with your legs extended.
8. Repeat exercise.

Core.name: Crunches
instructions: 1. Lie down on the floor with your knees bent and your feet planted hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands crossing over your chest OR with your elbows out wide with your hands behind your head, with your fingers grazing your ears.
3. Relax your shoulders and keep your gaze neutral and tuck your chin slightly towards your chest.
4. Inhale, drawing your abdomen in towards your spine. Exhale and lift your head, neck and shoulder blades off the floor, curling inwards.
5. Repeat exercise.

Core.name: Bicycle Crunches
instructions: 1. Lie down on the floor with your knees bent and your feet planted hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands gently on your head with your elbows out wide, with your fingers grazing your ears.
3. Lift one leg off the ground and straighten it outwards, raising the opposite knee upwards towards your chest.
4. Lift your chest upwards and turn your torso—opposite elbow to opposite knee.
5. Lower back to a neutral position with your knees raised. Switch to the other side—opposite elbow and opposite knee.
6. Repeat exercise.

Core.name: Reverse Crunches
instructions: 1. Lie down on the floor with your knees bent and your feet planted hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on the floor by your side.
3. Inhale, contract your abs towards your spine.
4. Exhale and lift your feet off the floor and raise your knees upwards and inwards towards your chest, keeping your knees at a 90 degree angle. Your hips should tilt inwards to crunch your abs.
5. Repeat exercise.

Core.name: Standing Oblique Crunches
instructions: 1. Stand with your knees slightly bent, your feet hip-width apart, and your hands behind your head.
2. Shift your weight to the left leg, crunch to the right side, and bring your right knee up toward your elbow.
3. Lower your right leg and return to the starting position.
4. Switch sides.
5. Repeat exercise.

Core.name: Flutter Kicks
instructions: 1. Lay on your back, extending your legs at a 45-degree angle. Your arms should be down at your sides and your legs off the ground.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and neck slightly off the ground.
3. Start kicking your legs up and down, alternating as you go. Flutter your legs at a pace you can maintain whilst also keeping your core still.
4. Flutter as long as possible.

Core.name: Lying Leg Raises
instructions: 1. Lay supine in a relaxed position with your legs straight and your hands underneath your low back for support.
2. Keep your legs straight and raise them towards your forehead while contracting your abdominals and exhaling.
3. Once your abs are fully contracted and your legs are slightly above parallel, slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.
4. Repeat exercise.

Core.name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: 1. Get into a plank position, making sure to distribute your weight evenly between your hands and your toes.
2. Check your form—your hands should be about shoulder-width apart, back flat, abs engaged, and head in alignment.
3. Pull your right knee into your chest as far as you can.
4. Switch legs, pulling one knee out and bringing the other knee in.
5. Keep your hips down and run your knees in and out as far and as fast as you can. Alternate inhaling and exhaling with each leg change.
6. Repeat as long as possible.

Core.name: Planks
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees, then lower down to your forearms with your elbows stacked beneath your shoulders.
2. Step your feet back until your body makes a line from shoulders to heels.
3. Squeeze your core and think about pulling your belly button towards your sternum to engage the abs.
4. Hold the position for as long as possible.

Core.name: Side Planks
instructions: 1. Lie on your side, legs extended and stacked.
2. Place your elbow under your shoulder and lift your hips to form a straight line.
3. Hold this position for 30 seconds or longer.
4. Switch sides.

Core.name: Russian Twists
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor or mat with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
2. Sitting up, angle your upper body 45 degrees backward. Keep your back neutral and your shoulders in their natural position in order to maintain good posture and avoid strain.
3. Gently lift your feet a few inches off the ground, being sure to keep your back neutral and at a 45-degree angle throughout.
4. Rotate your arms to one side of your body, and then rotate them to the opposite side.

Core.name: Scissor Kicks
instructions: 1. Lay on your with your hands on your side.
2. Pick your feet up off the ground 6-8 inches.
3. Bring your right foot over your left foot and then alternate your left foot over your right foot.
4. Alternate back and forth so that it looks like a scissor motion.

Core.name: Seated Knee Tucks
instructions: 1. Sit down with your hands on the mat, your legs fully extended, and lean back.
2. Bend your legs and bring your knees toward your chest.
3. Hold for a second or two and then fully extend your legs without touching the mat.
4. Repeat exercise.

Core.name: Sit-ups
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor and place your hands behind your head or cross them over your chest.
2. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees. Keep your feet flat on the floor and exhale as you sit up.
3. Slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position, inhale as you lower down.
4. Repeat exercise

Core.name: Toe Touches
instructions: 1. Lie flat on your back with legs extended straight up towards the ceiling. Your arms can be extended alongside your body or reaching towards your toes.
2. Engage your core and lift your upper back off the floor. Reach your hands towards your toes, aiming to touch them.
3. Slowly lower your upper back back down to the floor with control.

Core.name: V-ups
instructions: 1. Lie flat on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your arms and legs to form a V-shape, trying to touch your hands to your toes. Keep your legs as straight as possible throughout the movement.
3. Lower your arms and legs back to the starting position with control.

Glutes.name: Bridge
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent.
2. Tighten the muscles in your stomach.
3. Raise your hips off the floor until they line up with your knees and shoulders.
4. Hold for a chosen amount of time.

Glutes.name: Clamshells
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with your knees slightly bent and with one leg on top of the other.
2. Keep your feet together and lift your top knee until it’s parallel with your hip.
3. Lower your knee back to the initial position.
4. Repeat and then switch sides.

Glutes.name: Donkey Kicks
instructions: 1. Get down on your hands and knees, with your hands under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
2. Flex your right foot, lift your right leg up, keeping the knee bent at a 90-degree angle, and squeeze the glutes.
3. Return to the starting position.
4. Repeat, and switch legs.

Glutes.name: Fire Hydrants
instructions: 1. Get down on your hands and knees, with your wrists under your shoulders and your knees hip-width apart.
2. Keeping the knee bent, raise one leg up and out to the side, until it’s level with your hip.
3. Return to the starting position.
4. Repeat, and then switch legs.

Glutes.name: Hip Thrusts
instructions: 1. Lie on your back on the floor, with knees bent, feet planted firmly on the floor.
2. Press your heels into the floor, driving your hips upwards. Pause at the top, making sure to squeeze your glutes.
3.Slowly return to your starting position.
4. Repeat for a desired amount.

Glutes.name: Lunges
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, keep your back straight, your shoulders back, and your abs tight.
2. Take a step forward and slowly bend both knees, until your back knee is just above the floor.
3. Stand back up and repeat the movement.
4. Alternate legs until the set is complete.

Glutes.name: Variation: Reverse Lunges
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Squeeze your glutes and shoulder blades, keeping your gaze neutral at a point straight ahead of you.
2. Step one leg back and slightly out, landing with your toe first. Work to avoid slamming your knee into the ground and bending your knees to form right angles with both of your legs.
3. Drive off the ground with your front foot and step your rear leg forward into the starting position.
4. Repeat exercise.

Glutes.name: Variation: Lateral Lunges
instructions: 1. Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart.
2. Step out to the side and transfer your weight to that leg.
3. Use your lead foot to push you back to the starting position.
4. Repeat and then switch sides.

Glutes.name: Variation: Walking Lunges
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, take a step forward with your right foot and then slowly bend both knees until your back knee is just above the floor.
2. Stand back up, take a step forward with your left foot and bend both knees until your back knee is just above the floor.
3. Repeat this forward movement for the entire duration of the set.

Glutes.name: Quadruped Leg Raise
instructions: 1. Start on your hands and knees.
2. Raise leg straight out while tightening your core. Hold the position for 5 seconds.
3. Lower your leg back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the move with the opposite leg.

Glutes.name: Quadruped Hip Extensions
instructions: 1. Engage your core and make sure your back is straight and flat from the base of your pelvis to the top of your head.
2. Shift your weight slightly to the right side, keeping your torso stable as you do—your hips and shoulders shouldn't twist or rotate as you shift.
3. Press your left foot up toward the ceiling, keeping your knee bent at a 90-degree angle as you fully

Glutes.name: Side Leg Raises
instructions: 1. Stand up straight with your feet together and your hands on your hips.
2. Slowly lift your right leg straight out to the side.
3. Pause, then slowly lower the leg. Keep your hips even throughout.
4. Repeat exercise and change legs.

Glutes.name: Single-Leg Glute Bridges
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with your arms by your sides, knees bent, and feet flat on the floor.
2. Raise one leg and lift your hips as high as you can.
3. Lower your hips to the initial position.
4. Repeat exercise, and then switch legs.

Glutes.name: Standing Kickbacks
instructions: 1. Lift one leg off the ground and extend it behind you. Keep your knee straight and squeeze your glutes as you lift your leg.
2. Keep Core Engaged: Throughout the exercise, keep your core tight.
3. Repeat exercise, and then switch legs.

Glutes.name: Squats
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet wider than your Hips and feet pointed slightly out.
2. Begin bending your knees until parallel to the floor with your back as straight as possible.
3. Push back up until you reach standing positions.
4. Repeat.

Glutes.name: Variation: Bulgarian Split Squats
instructions: 1. Stand with feet hip width apart and approximately 2 shoulder widths in length with shoelaces down on a bench.
2. Drop the trailing knee down until it is slightly off the ground maintaining a slight forward torso angle.
3. Reverse the pattern and return to the starting position.

Glutes.name: Variation: Plie Squats
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet in a wide stance, your toes pointing out to the sides.
2. Squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Stand up and bring the dumbbells together in front of your chest.
4. Repeat exercise.

Glutes.name: Variation: Sumo Squats
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet in a wide stance and with your toes pointing out to the sides.
2. Lower yourself by bending your knees and pressing your hips back. Bend your upper body forwards.
3. Once your thighs are parallel to the floor, come back up and repeat.

Glutes.name: Wall Sit
instructions: 1. Start in a squat position, with your thighs parallel to the floor and your back against a wall.
2. Hold this position for as long as you can.

Glutes.name: Variation: Wall Sit with Leg Lifts
instructions: 1. Start in a squat position, with your thighs parallel to the floor and your back against a wall.
2. Slowly lift one leg and create tension in the other that is grounded.
3. Alternate between legs.

Legs.name: Alternating Split Stance Jumps
instructions: 1. Start in a split stance with one foot positioned forward and one foot positioned back, as if you're about to lunge.
2. Bend your knees to lower your body into a lunge position, keeping your front knee aligned with your ankle and your back knee hovering just above the ground.

3. Explosively jump into the air, switching the position of your legs mid-air so that you land with the opposite foot forward and the other foot back. Land softly with bent knees to absorb the impact, then immediately lower back into a lunge position and explode into the next jump.
4. Continue alternating legs with each jump in a fluid and controlled motion.

Legs.name: Boxer Shuffle
instructions: 1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Lift your heels off the ground so you're on the balls of your feet.
2. Begin moving your feet in a quick, rhythmic pattern, shuffling back and forth as if you're in a boxing ring.
3. Keep your movements light and quick, staying on the balls of your feet and maintaining a slight bend in your knees to absorb the impact.

Legs.name: Butt Kicks
instructions: 1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your arms by your sides.
2. Begin jogging in place, lifting your heels up towards your glutes with each step so that your feet make contact with your buttocks.
3. Swing your arms naturally to help increase momentum and coordination.

Legs.name: Flutter Kicks
instructions: 1. Lie flat on your back with your arms by your sides and your legs fully extended.
2. Engage your core muscles to press your lower back into the ground and lift your legs a few inches off the floor.
3. Keeping your legs straight, begin to alternate kicking them up and down in a fluttering motion, as if you're swimming freestyle.
4. Avoid arching your back or lifting your legs too high to ensure proper engagement of the abdominal muscles.

Legs.name: Half Squat Walk
instructions: 1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your toes pointed slightly outward.

2. Bend your knees and lower your body into a half squat position, keeping your chest up and your back straight. Your thighs should be parallel to the ground, and your knees should be aligned with your ankles.
3. Hold this squat position as you take small steps forward, maintaining the half squat position throughout the movement.
4. Take small, controlled steps to ensure proper form and engagement of the muscles.

Legs.name: High Kicks
instructions: 1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms by your sides.
2. Engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine and maintain good posture throughout the movement.

3. Lift one leg straight out in front of you as high as you comfortably can while keeping it straight. Reach your opposite arm forward to touch your toes or reach towards your raised foot. Keep your standing leg slightly bent and your toes pointed upwards.
4. Lower your leg back down to the ground with control, then repeat the movement on the opposite side. Alternate legs in a fluid and controlled motion, kicking as high as you can.

Legs.name: Jumping Jack
instructions: 1. Start by standing tall with your feet together and your arms by your sides.
2. Jump up explosively while simultaneously spreading your legs out to the sides and raising your arms above your head until your hands clap together overhead.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
4. Jump up again, returning to the starting position with your feet together and your arms by your sides.
5. Continue jumping and repeating the movement.

Legs.name: Knee Side Leg Lifts
instructions: 1. Start by lying on your side with your bottom arm extended straight out for support and your head resting comfortably on it.
2. Bend your bottom leg slightly for stability and keep your top leg straight.
3. Engage your core muscles and lift your top leg upward towards the ceiling as high as you comfortably can, keeping it straight and in line with your body.
4. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your leg back down to the starting position with control.
5. Repeat exercise.

Legs.name: Lateral Hops
instructions: 1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Keep your chest up and your back straight.
2. Begin by jumping sideways to one side, landing softly on the balls of your feet with your knees slightly bent to absorb the impact.
3. Immediately jump back to the starting position, then jump sideways to the opposite side, again landing softly with your knees bent.

4. Continue jumping back and forth laterally in a quick and controlled motion, focusing on maintaining a brisk pace and landing softly with each jump. Use your arms to help propel you sideways and maintain balance throughout the movement.

Legs.name: Lying Leg Circles
instructions: 1. Start by lying flat on your back on a mat or exercise bench with your arms by your sides and your legs extended straight up towards the ceiling.

2. Engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine and press your lower back into the mat. Lower one leg down towards the ground in a controlled manner, keeping it straight and maintaining tension in your core.

3. Once your leg is a few inches above the ground, begin to make small circles with your foot, moving your entire leg in a circular motion. Keep the movement controlled and maintain tension in your core to prevent your lower back from arching off the ground.
4. After completing several circles in one direction, reverse the direction of the circles and continue for the same number of repetitions.
5. Once finished, switch legs and repeat the exercise on the opposite side.

Legs.name: Marching Hip Raises
instructions: 1. Start by lying flat on your back on a mat with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor.

2. Engage your core muscles, press your lower back into the mat and lift your hips off the ground by squeezing your glutes and driving through your heels until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
3. Maintain this hip raise position as you lift one knee towards your chest, keeping your thigh parallel to the ground.
4. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your foot back to the ground. Repeat the movement on the opposite side, lifting the opposite knee towards your chest.
5. Continue alternating legs in a marching motion while maintaining the hip raise position throughout the exercise.

Legs.name: Pulsing Side Lying Leg Raises
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with your bottom arm extended out for support and your head resting comfortably on it.
2. Keep your legs straight and stacked on top of each other, engage your core muscles to stabilize your spine and lift your top leg a few inches off the ground.

3. Instead of lifting the leg up and down in a full range of motion, pulse it up and down in a small, controlled motion within a short range. Focus on squeezing the outer thigh and glute muscles with each pulse.
4. After completing the desired number of pulses, switch to the other side and repeat the exercise.

Legs.name: Rainbow Leg Lifts
instructions: 1. Start by lying on your side with your bottom arm extended out for support and your head resting comfortably on it. Keep your legs straight and stacked on top of each other.
2. Engage your core muscles and lift your top leg upward towards the ceiling as high as you comfortably can while keeping it straight.
3. From this position, sweep your top leg in an arc motion over your bottom leg, aiming to draw a rainbow shape with your foot.
4. Bring your top leg back to the starting position without touching the ground, then repeat the movement.
5. Switch to the other side and repeat the exercise.

Legs.name: Standing Knee Raises
instructions: 1. Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms by your sides.
2. Engage your core muscles and lift one knee up towards your chest as high as you comfortably can while keeping your torso upright.
3. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your leg back down to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the movement on the same leg for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the opposite leg and repeat.

Legs.name: Side Lying Leg Lifts
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with your bottom arm extended out for support and your head resting comfortably on it. Keep your legs straight and stacked on top of each other.
2. Engage your core muscles and lift your top leg upward towards the ceiling as high as you comfortably can while keeping it straight.
3. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your leg back down to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the movement on the same side for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the opposite side and repeat.

Legs.name: Single Leg V-Ups
instructions: 1. Lie flat on your back on a mat with your arms extended overhead and your legs fully extended.
2. Engage your core muscles, press your lower back into the mat and lift one leg off the ground and simultaneously lift your upper body off the ground, reaching your arms towards your raised leg.
3. Aim to touch your toes or reach towards your raised foot with your hands. Keep your other leg extended straight and hovering a few inches off the ground throughout the movement.
4. Hold the top position briefly, then lower your upper body and leg back down to the starting position with control.
5. Switch to the opposite side and repeat.

Legs.name: Walking High Knees
instructions: 1. Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms by your sides.
2. Begin walking forward at a brisk pace while lifting your knees up towards your chest as high as you comfortably can with each step.
3. Keep your torso upright and your core engaged tand swing your arms naturally to help propel you forward and maintain balance.
4. Aim to maintain a steady rhythm and pace as you walk, focusing on lifting your knees high and driving them towards your chest with each step.
5. Continue walking high knees for a set distance or a specific duration, then gradually increase the intensity as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
